author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...ERICK NOW A HURRICANE... ...EXPECTED TO BRING HURRICANE CONDITIONS AND LIFE-THREATENING FLASH FLOODS TO PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN MEXICO LATER TONIGHT AND THURSDAY...
summary: ...ERICK NOW A HURRICANE... ...EXPECTED TO BRING HURRICANE CONDITIONS AND LIFE-THREATENING FLASH FLOODS TO PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN MEXICO LATER TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... As of 6:00 AM CST Wed Jun 18 the center of Erick was located near 13.5, -95.7 with movement NW at 7 mph. The minimum central pressure was 991 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 75 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...ERICK NOW A HURRICANE... ...EXPECTED TO BRING HURRICANE CONDITIONS AND LIFE-THREATENING FLASH FLOODS TO PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN MEXICO LATER TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... As of 6:00 AM CST Wed Jun 18 the center of Erick was located near 13.5, -95.7 with movement NW at 7 mph. The minimum central pressure was 991 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 75 mph.

title: Summary for Hurricane Erick (EP5/EP052025)
